title: Philippines quake damage - survivor of bay area disaster lives through philippines quake
author: Reuters
text: BAGUIO, Philippines - A San Francisco man who lived through last year's earthquake there had good reason to feel he is leading a charmed life today after surviving his second quake in nine months.        Steve Cox, who survived the October quake in the Bay Area, got through yesterday's powerful quake even though the road in front of him disappeared and his car was swept down a mountainside.        ``I was in the San Francisco one. . . . This one felt much stronger,'' he said. ``The aftershocks were really quite strong as well.''        He said he was driving toward Baguio, a mountain resort 55 miles north of Manila, when the quake hit. He jumped out of his car before it went off the side of a mountain.        It took him the two hours to finish his journey on foot to Baguio, arriving just in time to watch the final moments of the collapse of the Hyatt Hotel.Caption:  PHOTOAP: A PASSER-BY IS DWARFED BY HUGE SLABS OF CONCRETE FROM THE BAGUIO PARK HOTEL. THE SLABS CRUSHED PARKED VEHICLES AFTER THE HOTEL COLLAPSED IN YESTERDAY'S EARTHQUAKE.
